bug.author: rkraneis
bug.summary: Crash of GravesLSTMCharModellingExample in native code
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/dl4j-0.4-examples/files/280035/hs_err_pidXXXX.txt>hs_err_pidXXXX.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>C:\XXXX\dl4j-0.4-examples>java -cp target/deeplearning4j-examples-0.4-rc0-SNAPSHOT-bin.jar org.deeplearning4j.examples.recurrent.character.GravesLST MCharModellingExample Picked up _JAVA_OPTIONS: -Duser.home=C:\Users\XXXX Using existing text file at C:\Users\XXXX\AppData\Local\Temp\Shakespeare.txt Loaded and converted file: 5459809 valid characters of 5465100 total characters (5291 removed) Number of parameters in layer 0: 223000 Number of parameters in layer 1: 321400 Number of parameters in layer 2: 15477 Total number of network parameters: 559877 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 0 is 217.28348109866505 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 1 is 213.24020794270618 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 2 is 212.96007151220903 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 3 is 175.0605042276417 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 4 is 165.25273607110788 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 5 is 161.10226048465069 o.d.o.l.ScoreIterationListener - Score at iteration 6 is 160.24127280144648 # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO (0xc0000094) at pc=0x000000006c0b69ba, pid=6528, tid=2544 # # JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_74-b02) (build 1.8.0_74-b02) # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.74-b02 mixed mode windows-amd64 compressed oops) # Problematic frame: # C [libnd4j.dll+0x369ba] # # Failed to write core dump. Minidumps are not enabled by default on client versions of Windows # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # C:\NetBeansProjects\dl4j-0.4-examples\hs_err_pid6528.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://bugreport.java.com/bugreport/crash.jsp # The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code. # See problematic frame for where to report the bug. # </denchmark-code>

Sounds like a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/issues/1556>https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/issues/1556</denchmark-link>
Pull <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/libnd4j/pull/207>deeplearning4j/libnd4j#207</denchmark-link> should have fixed this. Are you still getting this issue after applying that fix?

The first few native frames are indeed the same: <denchmark-code>J 1494 org.nd4j.nativeblas.NativeOps.execReduceFloat([JIJJJJJJI)V (0 bytes) @ 0x0000000002de99c5 [0x0000000002de9940+0x85] J 1486 C1 org.nd4j.linalg.cpu.nativecpu.ops.NativeOpExecutioner.exec(Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ops/Accumulation;[I)Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray; (1441 bytes) @ 0x0000000002e1e6f4 [0x0000000002e14420+0xa2d4] J 1492 C1 org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.BaseNDArray.sum([I)Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray; (18 bytes) @ 0x0000000002e2e8d4 [0x0000000002e2e560+0x374] j org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.recurrent.LSTMHelpers.backpropGradientHelper(Lorg/deeplearning4j/nn/conf/NeuralNetConfiguration;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;ZILorg/deeplearning4j/nn/layers/recurrent/FwdPassReturn;ZLjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)Lorg/deeplearning4j/berkeley/Pair;+1688 j org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.recurrent.GravesLSTM.backpropGradientHelper(Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;ZI)Lorg/deeplearning4j/berkeley/Pair;+127 j org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.recurrent.GravesLSTM.tbpttBackpropGradient(Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;I)Lorg/deeplearning4j/berkeley/Pair;+4 </denchmark-code>
I'm unfortunately unable to build the native backend on this machine and will have to wait for the fix to appear on maven central.

I have another crash - this time after about 420 iterations in ntdll.dll. Same cause? The only change was increasing the log level of org.nd4j to TRACE in logback.xml. <denchmark-code># # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x0000000076eb0901, pid=16548, tid=11260 # # JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_74-b02) (build 1.8.0_74-b02) # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.74-b02 mixed mode windows-amd64 compressed oops) # Problematic frame: # C [ntdll.dll+0x50901] # # Failed to write core dump. Minidumps are not enabled by default on client versions of Windows # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # C:\NetBeansProjects\dl4j-0.4-examples\hs_err_pid16548.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://bugreport.java.com/bugreport/crash.jsp # The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code. # See problematic frame for where to report the bug. # </denchmark-code>

(67 bytes) @ 0x00000000028d063c [0x00000000028d0520+0x11c] J 2088 C1 org.deeplearning4j.optimize.solvers.StochasticGradientDescent.optimize()Z (147 bytes) @ 0x00000000028d1294 [0x00000000028d1180+0x114] J 2087 C1 org.deeplearning4j.optimize.Solver.optimize()V (26 bytes) @ 0x0000000002a643ac [0x0000000002a64200+0x1ac] j org.deeplearning4j.nn.multilayer.MultiLayerNetwork.doTruncatedBPTT(Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;Lorg/nd4j/linalg/api/ndarray/INDArray;)V+447 j org.deeplearning4j.nn.multilayer.MultiLayerNetwork.fit(Lorg/nd4j/linalg/dataset/api/DataSet;)V+38 j org.deeplearning4j.examples.recurrent.character.GravesLSTMCharModellingExample.main([Ljava/lang/String;)V+440 v ~StubRoutines::call_stub ``Â´ </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/saudet>@saudet</denchmark-link> , running the example with nd4j-0.4-rc3.10-SNAPSHOT yields <denchmark-code>Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/nd4j/linalg/cache/ConstantHandler at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:264) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initWithBackend(Nd4j.java:4743) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initContext(Nd4j.java:4716) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.<clinit>(Nd4j.java:148) at org.deeplearning4j.nn.conf.NeuralNetConfiguration$Builder.seed(NeuralNetConfiguration.java:487) at org.deeplearning4j.examples.recurrent.character.GravesLSTMCharModellingExample.main(GravesLSTMCharModellingExample.java:78) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.nd4j.linalg.cache.ConstantHandler at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:381) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:331) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357) ... 7 more </denchmark-code>
I changed nothing else in the POM and compiled nd4j with unit tests enabled and libnd4j against blas and lapack (no openblas on debian).

Please, try to add this dependency explicitly, and tell if that helps or not <denchmark-code><dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-api</artifactId> <version>${nd4j.version}</version> </dependency> </denchmark-code>
Yes, that did the trick. Thanks, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/raver119>@raver119</denchmark-link> .
Thanks, i'll take care of that issue then.

Well, it's not a bug, it's just a version clash. Your pom.xml uses release version of dl4j, and snapshot version of nd4j. So it looks like dl4j used release version of nd4j-api instead of snapshot. Usually it's good idea to use the same versions for everything. That's exactly the case here.
OK. My test for the original issue ist still running (which is a good sign, i think :-)). I will retest after building dl4j 3.10-SNAPSHOT.
Closing as this is with a very old version. Please re-open or submit a new ticket if the issue still exists with 0.8 or later.
